intro: Alchemilla fissa var. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean lady's mantle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pyrenees region. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade.
